Detailed Description

Member Enumeration Documentation

◆ Attitude

enum Creature::Attitude : int
strong

Simplified attitude towards any creature: hostile - hate, want to kill, etc.

neutral - anything between. friendly - avoid harming it, maybe even help. any - any of the above, used in safemode_ui

Enumerator
HOSTILE 
NEUTRAL 
FRIENDLY 
ANY

◆ add_effect() [3/6]

void Creature::add_effect ( const effect_source &  source,
const efftype_id &  eff_id,
const time_duration &  dur,
bodypart_id  bp,
bool  permanent = false,
int  intensity = 0,
bool  force = false,
bool  deferred = false 
)

Adds or modifies an effect.

If intensity is given it will set the effect intensity to the given value, or as close as max_intensity values permit.

Definition at line 1535 of file creature.cpp.

1537 {
1538  // Check our innate immunity
1539  if( !force && is_immune_effect( eff_id ) ) {
1540  return;
1541  }
1542  if( eff_id == effect_knockdown && ( has_effect( effect_ridden ) ||
1543  has_effect( effect_riding ) ) ) {
1544  monster *mons = dynamic_cast<monster *>( this );
1545  if( mons && mons->mounted_player ) {
1546  mons->mounted_player->forced_dismount();
1547  }
1548  }
1549 
1550  if( !eff_id.is_valid() ) {
1551  debugmsg( "Invalid effect, ID: %s", eff_id.c_str() );
1552  return;
1553  }
1554  const effect_type &type = eff_id.obj();
1555 
1556  // Mutate to a main (HP'd) body_part if necessary.
1557  if( type.get_main_parts() ) {
1558  bp = bp->main_part;
1559  }
1560 
1561  // Filter out bodypart immunity
1562  for( json_character_flag flag : eff_id->immune_bp_flags ) {
1563  if( bp->has_flag( flag ) ) {
1564  return;
1565  }
1566  }
1567 
1568  // Then check if the effect is blocked by another
1569  for( auto &elem : *effects ) {
1570  for( auto &_effect_it : elem.second ) {
1571  for( const auto &blocked_effect : _effect_it.second.get_blocks_effects() ) {
1572  if( blocked_effect == eff_id ) {
1573  // The effect is blocked by another, return
1574  return;
1575  }
1576  }
1577  }
1578  }
1579 
1580  bool found = false;
1581  // Check if we already have it
1582  auto matching_map = effects->find( eff_id );
1583  if( matching_map != effects->end() ) {
1584  auto &bodyparts = matching_map->second;
1585  auto found_effect = bodyparts.find( bp );
1586  if( found_effect != bodyparts.end() ) {
1587  found = true;
1588  effect &e = found_effect->second;
1589  const int prev_int = e.get_intensity();
1590  // If we do, mod the duration, factoring in the mod value
1591  e.mod_duration( dur * e.get_dur_add_perc() / 100 );
1592  // Limit to max duration
1593  if( e.get_duration() > e.get_max_duration() ) {
1594  e.set_duration( e.get_max_duration() );
1595  }
1596  // Adding a permanent effect makes it permanent
1597  if( e.is_permanent() ) {
1598  e.pause_effect();
1599  }
1600  // int_dur_factor overrides all other intensity settings
1601  // ...but it's handled in set_duration, so explicitly do nothing here
1602  if( e.get_int_dur_factor() > 0_turns ) {
1603  // Set intensity if value is given
1604  } else if( intensity > 0 ) {
1605  e.set_intensity( intensity, is_avatar() );
1606  // Else intensity uses the type'd step size if it already exists
1607  } else if( e.get_int_add_val() != 0 ) {
1608  e.mod_intensity( e.get_int_add_val(), is_avatar() );
1609  }
1610 
1611  // Bound intensity by [1, max intensity]
1612  if( e.get_intensity() < 1 ) {
1613  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_CREATURE, "Bad intensity, ID: %s", e.get_id().c_str() );
1614  e.set_intensity( 1 );
1615  } else if( e.get_intensity() > e.get_max_intensity() ) {
1616  e.set_intensity( e.get_max_intensity() );
1617  }
1618  if( e.get_intensity() != prev_int ) {
1619  on_effect_int_change( eff_id, e.get_intensity(), bp );
1620  }
1621  }
1622  }
1623 
1624  if( !found ) {
1625  // If we don't already have it then add a new one
1626 
1627  // Now we can make the new effect for application
1628  effect e( effect_source( source ), &type, dur, bp.id(), permanent, intensity, calendar::turn );
1629  // Bound to max duration
1630  if( e.get_duration() > e.get_max_duration() ) {
1631  e.set_duration( e.get_max_duration() );
1632  }
1633 
1634  // Force intensity if it is duration based
1635  if( e.get_int_dur_factor() != 0_turns ) {
1636  // + 1 here so that the lowest is intensity 1, not 0
1637  e.set_intensity( e.get_duration() / e.get_int_dur_factor() + 1 );
1638  }
1639  // Bound new effect intensity by [1, max intensity]
1640  if( e.get_intensity() < 1 ) {
1641  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_CREATURE, "Bad intensity, ID: %s", e.get_id().c_str() );
1642  e.set_intensity( 1 );
1643  } else if( e.get_intensity() > e.get_max_intensity() ) {
1644  e.set_intensity( e.get_max_intensity() );
1645  }
1646  ( *effects )[eff_id][bp] = e;
1647  if( Character *ch = as_character() ) {
1648  get_event_bus().send<event_type::character_gains_effect>( ch->getID(), bp.id(), eff_id );
1649  if( is_avatar() ) {
1650  eff_id->add_apply_msg( e.get_intensity() );
1651  }
1652  }
1653  on_effect_int_change( eff_id, e.get_intensity(), bp );
1654  // Perform any effect addition effects.

◆ attack_air()

bool Creature::attack_air ( const tripoint &  p)

Definition at line 1415 of file creature.cpp.

1416 {
1417  // Calculate move cost differently for monsters and npcs
1418  int move_cost = 100;
1419  if( is_monster() ) {
1420  move_cost = as_monster()->type->attack_cost;
1421  } else if( is_npc() ) {
1422  // Simplified moves calculation from Character::melee_attack_abstract
1423  item_location cur_weapon = as_character()->used_weapon();
1424  item cur_weap = cur_weapon ? *cur_weapon : null_item_reference();
1425  move_cost = as_character()->attack_speed( cur_weap ) * ( 1 /
1426  as_character()->exertion_adjusted_move_multiplier( EXTRA_EXERCISE ) );
1427  }
1428  mod_moves( -move_cost );
1429 
1430  // Attack animation
1431  if( get_option<bool>( "ANIMATIONS" ) ) {
1432  std::map<tripoint, nc_color> area_color;
1433  area_color[p] = c_black;
1434  explosion_handler::draw_custom_explosion( p, area_color, "animation_hit" );
1435  }
1436 
1437  // Chance to remove last known location
1438  if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
1439  get_map().set_field_intensity( p, field_fd_last_known, 0 );
1440  }
1441 
1442  add_msg_if_player_sees( *this, _( "%s attacks, but there is nothing there!" ),
1443  disp_name( false, true ) );
1444  return true;
1445 }

◆ auto_find_hostile_target()

Creature * Creature::auto_find_hostile_target ( int  range,
int &  boo_hoo,
int  area = 0 
)

For fake-players (turrets, mounted turrets) this functions chooses a target.

This is for creatures that are friendly towards the player and therefore choose a target that is hostile to the player.

Parameters
rangeThe maximal range to look for monsters, anything outside of that range is ignored.
boo_hooThe number of targets that have been skipped because the player is in the way.
areaThe area of effect of the projectile aimed.

Definition at line 554 of file creature.cpp.

555 {
556  Creature *target = nullptr;
557  Character &player_character = get_player_character();
558  tripoint player_pos = player_character.pos();
559  constexpr int hostile_adj = 2; // Priority bonus for hostile targets
560  const int iff_dist = ( range + area ) * 3 / 2 + 6; // iff check triggers at this distance
561  // iff safety margin (degrees). less accuracy, more paranoia
562  units::angle iff_hangle = units::from_degrees( 15 + area );
563  float best_target_rating = -1.0f; // bigger is better
564  units::angle u_angle = {}; // player angle relative to turret
565  boo_hoo = 0; // how many targets were passed due to IFF. Tragically.
566  bool self_area_iff = false; // Need to check if the target is near the vehicle we're a part of
567  bool area_iff = false; // Need to check distance from target to player
568  bool angle_iff = sees( player_character ); // Need to check if player is in cone to target
569  int pldist = rl_dist( pos(), player_pos );
570  map &here = get_map();
571  vehicle *in_veh = is_fake() ? veh_pointer_or_null( here.veh_at( pos() ) ) : nullptr;
572  if( pldist < iff_dist && angle_iff ) {
573  area_iff = area > 0;
574  // Player inside vehicle won't be hit by shots from the roof,
575  // so we can fire "through" them just fine.
576  const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( player_pos );
577  if( in_veh && veh_pointer_or_null( vp ) == in_veh && vp->is_inside() ) {
578  angle_iff = false; // No angle IFF, but possibly area IFF
579  } else if( pldist < 3 ) {
580  // granularity increases with proximity
581  iff_hangle = ( pldist == 2 ? 30_degrees : 60_degrees );
582  }
583  u_angle = coord_to_angle( pos(), player_pos );
584  }
585 
586  if( area > 0 && in_veh != nullptr ) {
587  self_area_iff = true;
588  }
589 
590  std::vector<Creature *> targets = g->get_creatures_if( [&]( const Creature & critter ) {
591  if( critter.is_monster() ) {
592  // friendly to the player, not a target for us
593  return static_cast<const monster *>( &critter )->attitude( &player_character ) == MATT_ATTACK;
594  }
595  if( critter.is_npc() ) {
596  // friendly to the player, not a target for us
597  return static_cast<const npc *>( &critter )->get_attitude() == NPCATT_KILL;
598  }
599  // TODO: what about g->u?
600  return false;
601  } );
602  for( Creature *&m : targets ) {
603  if( !sees( *m ) ) {
604  // can't see nor sense it
605  if( is_fake() && in_veh ) {
606  // If turret in the vehicle then
607  // Hack: trying yo avoid turret LOS blocking by frames bug by trying to see target from vehicle boundary
608  // Or turret wallhack for turret's car
609  // TODO: to visibility checking another way, probably using 3D FOV
610  std::vector<tripoint> path_to_target = line_to( pos(), m->pos() );
611  path_to_target.insert( path_to_target.begin(), pos() );
612 
613  // Getting point on vehicle boundaries and on line between target and turret
614  bool continueFlag = true;
615  do {
616  const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( path_to_target.back() );
617  vehicle *const veh = vp ? &vp->vehicle() : nullptr;
618  if( in_veh == veh ) {
619  continueFlag = false;
620  } else {
621  path_to_target.pop_back();
622  }
623  } while( continueFlag );
624 
625  tripoint oldPos = pos();
626  setpos( path_to_target.back() ); //Temporary moving targeting npc on vehicle boundary position
627  bool seesFromVehBound = sees( *m ); // And look from there
628  setpos( oldPos );
629  if( !seesFromVehBound ) {
630  continue;
631  }
632  } else {
633  continue;
634  }
635  }
636  int dist = rl_dist( pos(), m->pos() ) + 1; // rl_dist can be 0
637  if( dist > range + 1 || dist < area ) {
638  // Too near or too far
639  continue;
640  }
641  // Prioritize big, armed and hostile stuff
642  float mon_rating = m->power_rating();
643  float target_rating = mon_rating / dist;
644  if( mon_rating + hostile_adj <= 0 ) {
645  // We wouldn't attack it even if it was hostile
646  continue;
647  }
648 
649  if( in_veh != nullptr && veh_pointer_or_null( here.veh_at( m->pos() ) ) == in_veh ) {
650  // No shooting stuff on vehicle we're a part of
651  continue;
652  }
653  if( area_iff && rl_dist( player_pos, m->pos() ) <= area ) {
654  // Player in AoE
655  boo_hoo++;
656  continue;
657  }
658  // Hostility check can be expensive, but we need to inform the player of boo_hoo
659  // only when the target is actually "hostile enough"
660  bool maybe_boo = false;
661  if( angle_iff ) {
662  units::angle tangle = coord_to_angle( pos(), m->pos() );
663  units::angle diff = units::fabs( u_angle - tangle );
664  // Player is in the angle and not too far behind the target
665  if( ( diff + iff_hangle > 360_degrees || diff < iff_hangle ) &&
666  ( dist * 3 / 2 + 6 > pldist ) ) {
667  maybe_boo = true;
668  }
669  }
670  if( !maybe_boo && ( ( mon_rating + hostile_adj ) / dist <= best_target_rating ) ) {
671  // "Would we skip the target even if it was hostile?"
672  // Helps avoid (possibly expensive) attitude calculation
673  continue;
674  }
675  if( m->attitude_to( player_character ) == Attitude::HOSTILE ) {
676  target_rating = ( mon_rating + hostile_adj ) / dist;
677  if( maybe_boo ) {
678  boo_hoo++;
679  continue;
680  }
681  }
682  if( target_rating <= best_target_rating || target_rating <= 0 ) {
683  continue; // Handle this late so that boo_hoo++ can happen
684  }
685  // Expensive check for proximity to vehicle
686  if( self_area_iff && overlaps_vehicle( in_veh->get_points(), m->pos(), area ) ) {
687  continue;
688  }
689 
690  target = m;
691  best_target_rating = target_rating;
692  }
693  return target;
694 }

Character & get_player_character()

◆ check_dead_state()

void Creature::check_dead_state ( )

This function checks the creatures is_dead_state and (if true) calls die.

You can either call this function after hitting this creature, or let the game call it during game::cleanup_dead. As die has many side effects (messages, on-death-triggers, ...), you should be careful when calling this and expect that at least a "The monster dies!" message might have been printed. If you want to print any message relating to the attack (e.g. how much damage has been dealt, how the attack was performed, what has been blocked...), do it before calling this function.

Definition at line 3067 of file creature.cpp.

3068 {
3069  if( is_dead_state() ) {
3070  die( killer );
3071  }
3072 }
Creature::die
virtual void die(Creature *killer)=0
Empty function.

◆ deal_damage()

dealt_damage_instance Creature::deal_damage ( Creature *  source,
bodypart_id  bp,
const damage_instance &  dam,
const weakpoint_attack &  attack = weakpoint_attack() 
)
virtual

Deals the damage via an attack.

Allows armor mitigation etc.

Most sources of external damage should use deal_damage Mutates the damage_instance& object passed in to reflect the post-mitigation object. Does nothing if this creature is already dead. Does not call check_dead_state.

Parameters
sourceThe attacking creature, can be null.
bpThe attacked body part
damThe damage dealt

Reimplemented in Character.

Definition at line 1221 of file creature.cpp.

1223 {
1224  if( is_dead_state() ) {
1225  return dealt_damage_instance();
1226  }
1227  int total_damage = 0;
1228  int total_base_damage = 0;
1229  int total_pain = 0;
1230  damage_instance d = dam; // copy, since we will mutate in absorb_hit
1231 
1232  weakpoint_attack attack_copy = attack;
1233  attack_copy.source = source;
1234  attack_copy.target = this;
1235  attack_copy.compute_wp_skill();
1236 
1237  dealt_damage_instance dealt_dams;
1238  const weakpoint *wp = absorb_hit( attack_copy, bp, d );
1239  dealt_dams.wp_hit = wp == nullptr ? "" : wp->get_name();
1240 
1241  // Add up all the damage units dealt
1242  for( const damage_unit &it : d.damage_units ) {
1243  int cur_damage = 0;
1244  deal_damage_handle_type( effect_source( source ), it, bp, cur_damage, total_pain );
1245  total_base_damage += std::max( 0.0f, it.amount * it.unconditional_damage_mult );
1246  if( cur_damage > 0 ) {
1247  dealt_dams.dealt_dams[it.type] += cur_damage;
1248  total_damage += cur_damage;
1249  }
1250  }
1251  // get eocs for all damage effects
1252  d.ondamage_effects( source, this, dam, bp.id() );
1253 
1254  if( total_base_damage < total_damage ) {
1255  // Only deal more HP than remains if damage not including crit multipliers is higher.
1256  total_damage = clamp( get_hp( bp ), total_base_damage, total_damage );
1257  }
1258  if( !bp->has_flag( json_flag_BIONIC_LIMB ) ) {
1259  mod_pain( total_pain );
1260  }
1261 
1262  apply_damage( source, bp, total_damage );
1263 
1264  if( wp != nullptr ) {
1265  wp->apply_effects( *this, total_damage, attack_copy );
1266  }
1267 
1268  return dealt_dams;
1269 }

void Creature::deal_damage_handle_type ( const effect_source &  source,

Definition at line 1270 of file creature.cpp.

1272 {
1273  // Handles ACIDPROOF, electric immunity etc.
1274  if( is_immune_damage( du.type ) ) {
1275  return;
1276  }
1277 
1278  // Apply damage multiplier from skill, critical hits or grazes after all other modifications.
1279  const int adjusted_damage = du.amount * du.damage_multiplier * du.unconditional_damage_mult;
1280  if( adjusted_damage <= 0 ) {
1281  return;
1282  }
1283 
1284  float div = 4.0f;
1285 
1286  // FIXME: Hardcoded damage types
1287  if( du.type == damage_bash ) {
1288  // Bashing damage is less painful
1289  div = 5.0f;
1290  } else if( du.type == damage_heat ) {
1291  // heat damage sets us on fire sometimes
1292  if( rng( 0, 100 ) < adjusted_damage ) {
1293  add_effect( source, effect_onfire, rng( 1_turns, 3_turns ), bp );
1294 
1295  Character &player_character = get_player_character();
1296  if( player_character.has_trait( trait_PYROMANIA ) &&
1297  !player_character.has_morale( MORALE_PYROMANIA_STARTFIRE ) && player_character.sees( *this ) ) {
1298  player_character.add_msg_if_player( m_good,
1299  _( "You feel a surge of euphoria as flame engulfs %s!" ), this->get_name() );
1300  player_character.add_morale( MORALE_PYROMANIA_STARTFIRE, 15, 15, 8_hours, 6_hours );
1301  player_character.rem_morale( MORALE_PYROMANIA_NOFIRE );
1302  }
1303  }
1304  } else if( du.type == damage_electric ) {
1305  // Electrical damage adds a major speed/dex debuff
1306  double multiplier = 1.0;
1307  if( monster *mon = as_monster() ) {
1308  multiplier = mon->type->status_chance_multiplier;
1309  }
1310  const int chance = std::log10( ( adjusted_damage + 2 ) * 0.5 ) * 100 * multiplier;
1311  if( x_in_y( chance, 100 ) ) {
1312  const int duration = std::max( adjusted_damage / 10.0 * multiplier, 2.0 );
1313  add_effect( source, effect_zapped, 1_turns * duration );
1314  }
1315 
1316  if( Character *ch = as_character() ) {
1317  const double pain_mult = ch->calculate_by_enchantment( 1.0, enchant_vals::mod::EXTRA_ELEC_PAIN );
1318  div /= pain_mult;
1319  if( pain_mult > 1.0 ) {
1320  ch->add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad, _( "You're painfully electrocuted!" ),
1321  _( "<npcname> is shocked!" ) );
1322  }
1323  }
1324  } else if( du.type == damage_acid ) {
1325  // Acid damage and acid burns are more painful
1326  div = 3.0f;
1327  }
1328 
1329  on_damage_of_type( source, adjusted_damage, du.type, bp );
1330 
1331  damage += adjusted_damage;
1332  pain += roll_remainder( adjusted_damage / div );
1333 }

775  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_CREATURE, "Base hitroll %d",
776  hitroll );

778  dodge );
779 
780  if( has_flag( mon_flag_IMMOBILE ) ) {
781  // Under normal circumstances, even a clumsy person would
782  // not miss a turret. It should, however, be possible to
783  // miss a smaller target, especially when wielding a
784  // clumsy weapon or when severely encumbered.
785  hit_spread += 40;
786  }
787

789  if( dodge > 0.0 && hit_spread <= 0 && source != nullptr && !source->is_hallucination() ) {

virtual

Attempts to harm a creature with a projectile.

Parameters
sourcePointer to the creature who shot the projectile.
attackA structure describing the attack and its results.

1449  // If successfully uncanny dodged, no need to calculate dodge chance
1450  if( uncanny_dodge() ) {

1453 
1454  const float dodge_ability = dodge_roll();
1455  // center is 5 - 0 / 2
1456  // stddev is 5 - 0 / 4
1457  const float dodge_chance = 1 - normal_roll_chance( 2.5f, 1.25f, dodge_ability - hit_roll );
1458  if( dodge_chance >= 0.8f || force_try ) {
1459  on_try_dodge();

1461  return dodge_ability > attack_roll;
1462  }

1492  }

1496  return dodge_check( z->get_hit(), true, training_level );

◆ get_part_id()

bodypart_id Creature::get_part_id ( const bodypart_id &  id,
body_part_filter  filter = body_part_filter::next_best,
bool  suppress_debugmsg = false 
) const

Definition at line 2240 of file creature.cpp.

2242 {
2243  auto found = body.find( id.id() );
2244  if( found != body.end() ) {
2245  return found->first;
2246  }
2247  // try to find an equivalent part in the body map
2248  if( filter >= body_part_filter::equivalent ) {
2249  for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, bodypart> &bp : body ) {
2250  if( id->part_side == bp.first->part_side &&
2251  id->primary_limb_type() == bp.first->primary_limb_type() ) {
2252  return bp.first;
2253  }
2254  }
2255  }
2256  // try to find the next best thing
2257  std::pair<bodypart_id, float> best = { body_part_bp_null, 0.0f };
2258  if( filter >= body_part_filter::next_best ) {
2259  for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, bodypart> &bp : body ) {
2260  for( const std::pair<const body_part_type::type, float> &mp : bp.first->limbtypes ) {
2261  // if the secondary limb type matches and is better than the current
2262  if( mp.first == id->primary_limb_type() && mp.second > best.second ) {
2263  // give an inflated bonus if the part sides match
2264  float bonus = id->part_side == bp.first->part_side ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
2265  best = { bp.first, mp.second + bonus };
2266  }
2267  }
2268  }
2269  }
2270  if( best.first == body_part_bp_null && !suppress_debugmsg ) {
2271  debugmsg( "Could not find equivalent bodypart id %s in %s's body", id.id().c_str(), get_name() );
2272  }
2273 
2274  return best.first;
2275 }
body_part_bp_null
const bodypart_str_id body_part_bp_null("bp_null")
body_part_filter::next_best
@ next_best
body_part_filter::equivalent
@ equivalent
kb_menu_status::filter
@ filter
base_camps::id
const std::string id
Definition: basecamp.h:105
body_part_type::part_side
side part_side
Definition: bodypart.h:270

◆ has_effect() [2/2]

bool Creature::has_effect ( const efftype_id &  eff_id,
const bodypart_id &  bp 
) const

Check if creature has the matching effect.

If the bodypart is not specified check if the Creature has any effect of the matching type, targeted or untargeted.

Definition at line 1770 of file creature.cpp.

1771 {
1772  // bp_null means anything targeted or not
1773  if( bp.id() == bodypart_str_id::NULL_ID() ) {
1774  return effects->count( eff_id );
1775  } else {
1776  auto got_outer = effects->find( eff_id );
1777  if( got_outer != effects->end() ) {
1778  auto got_inner = got_outer->second.find( bp.id() );
1779  if( got_inner != got_outer->second.end() ) {
1780  return true;

1782  }

3123  tripoint to = pos();

3125  to.x++;

3129  }

3132  }

3134  to.y--;
3135  }

◆ print_info()

virtual int Creature::print_info ( const catacurses::window &  w,
int  vStart,
int  vLines,
int  column 
) const
pure virtual

Write information about this creature.

Parameters
wthe window to print the text into.
vStartvertical start to print, that means the first line to print.
vLinesnumber of lines to print at most (printing less is fine).
columnhorizontal start to print (column), horizontal end is one character before the right border of the window (to keep the border).
Returns
The line just behind the last printed line, that means multiple calls to this can be stacked, the return value is acceptable as vStart for the next call without creating empty lines or overwriting lines.

Implemented in monster, avatar, and npc.

Referenced by game::list_monsters(), target_ui::panel_target_info(), and editmap::update_view_with_help().

◆ process_damage_over_time()

void Creature::process_damage_over_time ( )

Definition at line 3047 of file creature.cpp.

3048 {
3049  for( auto DoT = damage_over_time_map.begin(); DoT != damage_over_time_map.end(); ) {
3050  if( DoT->duration > 0_turns ) {
3051  for( const bodypart_str_id &bp : DoT->bps ) {
3052  const int dmg_amount = DoT->amount;
3053  if( dmg_amount < 0 ) {
3054  heal_bp( bp.id(), -dmg_amount );
3055  } else if( dmg_amount > 0 ) {
3056  deal_damage( nullptr, bp.id(), damage_instance( DoT->type, dmg_amount ) );
3057  }
3058  }
3059  DoT->duration -= 1_turns;
3060  ++DoT;
3061  } else {
3062  DoT = damage_over_time_map.erase( DoT );
3063  }
3064  }
3065 }
Creature::heal_bp
virtual void heal_bp(bodypart_id bp, int dam)
Definition: creature.cpp:1335

◆ process_effects()

void Creature::process_effects ( )
virtual

Processes through all the effects on the Creature.

Reimplemented in monster, and Character.

Definition at line 1881 of file creature.cpp.

1882 {
1883  // id's and body_part's of all effects to be removed. If we ever get player or
1884  // monster specific removals these will need to be moved down to that level and then
1885  // passed in to this function.
1886  std::vector<efftype_id> rem_ids;
1887  std::vector<bodypart_id> rem_bps;
1888 
1889  // Decay/removal of effects
1890  for( auto &elem : *effects ) {
1891  for( auto &_it : elem.second ) {
1892  // Add any effects that others remove to the removal list
1893  for( const auto &removed_effect : _it.second.get_removes_effects() ) {
1894  rem_ids.push_back( removed_effect );
1895  rem_bps.emplace_back( bodypart_str_id::NULL_ID() );
1896  }
1897  effect &e = _it.second;
1898  const int prev_int = e.get_intensity();
1899  // Run decay effects, marking effects for removal as necessary.
1900  e.decay( rem_ids, rem_bps, calendar::turn, is_avatar(), *effects );
1901 
1902  if( e.get_intensity() != prev_int && e.get_duration() > 0_turns ) {
1903  on_effect_int_change( e.get_id(), e.get_intensity(), e.get_bp() );
1904  }
1905 
1906  const bool reduced = resists_effect( e );
1907  if( e.kill_roll( reduced ) ) {
1908  add_msg_if_player( m_bad, e.get_death_message() );
1909  if( is_avatar() ) {
1910  std::map<std::string, cata_variant> event_data;
1911  std::pair<std::string, cata_variant> data_obj( "character",
1912  cata_variant::make<cata_variant_type::character_id>( as_character()->getID() ) );
1913  event_data.insert( data_obj );
1914  cata::event sent( e.death_event(), calendar::turn, std::move( event_data ) );
1915  get_event_bus().send( sent );
1916  }
1917  die( e.get_source().resolve_creature() );
1918  }
1919  }
1920  }
1921 
1922  // Actually remove effects. This should be the last thing done in process_effects().
1923  for( size_t i = 0; i < rem_ids.size(); ++i ) {
1924  remove_effect( rem_ids[i], rem_bps[i] );
1925  }
1926 }

◆ ranged_target_size()

double Creature::ranged_target_size ( ) const

Size of the target this creature presents to ranged weapons.

0.0 means unhittable, 1.0 means all projectiles going through this creature's tile will hit it.

552  character->is_running() ) ) {

554  } else if( character->is_prone() ) {

561  case creature_size::small:

564  return stance_factor * occupied_tile_fraction( creature_size::small );

567  case creature_size::huge:

◆ remove_effect() [2/2]

bool Creature::remove_effect ( const efftype_id &  eff_id,
const bodypart_id &  bp 
)

Removes a listed effect.

If the bodypart is not specified remove all effects of a given type, targeted or untargeted. Returns true if anything was removed.

Definition at line 1722 of file creature.cpp.

1725  //Effect doesn't exist, so do nothing
1726  return false;

1729

1733  add_msg( type.lose_game_message_type( get_effect( eff_id, bp.id() ).get_intensity() ),
1734  type.get_remove_message() );

1744  }

1752  }
1753  }
1754  return true;

◆ sees() [1/3]

bool Creature::sees ( const Creature &  critter) const
overridevirtual

The functions check whether this creature can see the target.

The target may either be another creature (critter), or a specific point on the map.

The function that take another creature as input should check visibility of that creature (e.g. not digging, or otherwise invisible). They must than check whether the location of the other monster is visible.

Implements viewer.

Definition at line 358 of file creature.cpp.

359 {
360  // Creatures always see themselves (simplifies drawing).
361  if( &critter == this ) {
362  return true;
363  }
364 
365  if( std::abs( posz() - critter.posz() ) > fov_3d_z_range ) {
366  return false;
367  }
368 
369  map &here = get_map();
370 
371  const int target_range = rl_dist( pos(), critter.pos() );
372  if( target_range > MAX_VIEW_DISTANCE ) {
373  return false;
374  }
375 
376  if( critter.has_flag( mon_flag_ALWAYS_VISIBLE ) || ( has_flag( mon_flag_ALWAYS_SEES_YOU ) &&
377  critter.is_avatar() ) ) {
378  return true;
379  }
380 
381  if( this->has_flag( mon_flag_ALL_SEEING ) ) {
382  const monster *m = this->as_monster();
383  return target_range <= std::max( m->type->vision_day, m->type->vision_night );
384  }
385 
386  if( critter.is_hallucination() && !is_avatar() ) {
387  // hallucinations are imaginations of the player character, npcs or monsters don't hallucinate.
388  return false;
389  }
390 
391  // Creature has stumbled into an invisible player and is now aware of them
392  if( has_effect( effect_stumbled_into_invisible ) &&
393  here.has_field_at( critter.pos(), field_fd_last_known ) && critter.is_avatar() ) {
394  return true;
395  }
396 
397  // This check is ridiculously expensive so defer it to after everything else.
398  auto visible = []( const Character * ch ) {
399  return ch == nullptr || !ch->is_invisible();
400  };
401 
402  const Character *ch = critter.as_character();
403 
404  // Can always see adjacent monsters on the same level.
405  // We also bypass lighting for vertically adjacent monsters, but still check for floors.
406  if( target_range <= 1 ) {
407  return ( posz() == critter.posz() || here.sees( pos(), critter.pos(), 1 ) ) && visible( ch );
408  }
409 
410  // If we cannot see without any of the penalties below, bail now.
411  if( !sees( critter.pos(), critter.is_avatar() ) ) {
412  return false;
413  }
414 
415  // Used with the Mind over Matter power Obscurity, to telepathically erase yourself from a target's perceptions
416  if( has_effect( effect_telepathic_ignorance ) &&
417  critter.has_effect( effect_telepathic_ignorance_self ) ) {
418  return false;
419  }
420 
421  if( ( target_range > 2 && critter.digging() &&
422  here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_DIGGABLE, critter.pos() ) ) ||
423  ( critter.has_flag( mon_flag_CAMOUFLAGE ) && target_range > this->get_eff_per() ) ||
424  ( critter.has_flag( mon_flag_WATER_CAMOUFLAGE ) &&
425  target_range > this->get_eff_per() &&
426  ( critter.is_likely_underwater() ||
427  here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_DEEP_WATER, critter.pos() ) ||
428  ( here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SHALLOW_WATER, critter.pos() ) &&
429  critter.get_size() < creature_size::medium ) ) ) ||
430  ( critter.has_flag( mon_flag_NIGHT_INVISIBILITY ) &&
431  here.light_at( critter.pos() ) <= lit_level::LOW ) ||
432  critter.has_effect( effect_invisibility ) ||
433  ( !is_likely_underwater() && critter.is_likely_underwater() &&
434  majority_rule( critter.has_flag( mon_flag_WATER_CAMOUFLAGE ),
435  here.has_flag( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_DEEP_WATER, critter.pos() ),
436  posz() != critter.posz() ) ) ||
437  ( here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_HIDE_PLACE, critter.pos() ) &&
438  !( std::abs( posx() - critter.posx() ) <= 1 && std::abs( posy() - critter.posy() ) <= 1 &&
439  std::abs( posz() - critter.posz() ) <= 1 ) ) ||
440  ( here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_SMALL_HIDE, critter.pos() ) &&
441  critter.has_flag( mon_flag_SMALL_HIDER ) &&
442  !( std::abs( posx() - critter.posx() ) <= 1 && std::abs( posy() - critter.posy() ) <= 1 &&
443  std::abs( posz() - critter.posz() ) <= 1 ) ) ) {
444  return false;
445  }
446  if( ch != nullptr ) {
447  if( ch->is_crouching() || ch->has_effect( effect_all_fours ) || ch->is_prone() ||
448  pos().z != critter.pos().z ) {
449  const int coverage = std::max( here.obstacle_coverage( pos(), critter.pos() ),
450  here.ledge_coverage( *this, critter.pos() ) );
451  if( coverage < 30 ) {
452  return visible( ch );
453  }
454  float size_modifier = 1.0f;
455  switch( ch->get_size() ) {
456  case creature_size::tiny:
457  size_modifier = 2.0f;
458  break;
459  case creature_size::small:
460  size_modifier = 1.4f;
461  break;
462  case creature_size::medium:
463  break;
464  case creature_size::large:
465  size_modifier = 0.6f;
466  break;
467  case creature_size::huge:
468  size_modifier = 0.15f;
469  break;
470  case creature_size::num_sizes:
471  debugmsg( "ERROR: Creature has invalid size class." );
472  break;
473  }
474 
475  int profile = 120 / size_modifier;
476  if( ch->is_crouching() || ch->has_effect( effect_all_fours ) ) {
477  profile *= 0.5;
478  } else if( ch->is_prone() ) {
479  profile *= 0.275;
480  }
481 
482  if( coverage < profile ) {
483  const int vision_modifier = std::max( 30 * ( 1 - coverage / profile ), 1 );
484  return target_range <= vision_modifier && visible( ch );
485  }
486  return false;
487  }
488  }
489  return visible( ch );
490 }
fov_3d_z_range
int fov_3d_z_range

◆ sees() [2/3]

bool Creature::sees ( const tripoint &  t,
bool  is_avatar = false,
int  range_mod = 0 
) const
overridevirtual

Implements viewer.

Definition at line 492 of file creature.cpp.

493 {
494  if( std::abs( posz() - t.z ) > fov_3d_z_range ) {
495  return false;
496  }
497 
498  map &here = get_map();
499  const int range_cur = sight_range( here.ambient_light_at( t ) );
500  const int range_day = sight_range( default_daylight_level() );
501  const int range_night = sight_range( 0 );
502  const int range_max = std::max( range_day, range_night );
503  const int range_min = std::min( range_cur, range_max );
504  const int wanted_range = rl_dist( pos(), t );
505  if( wanted_range <= range_min ||
506  ( wanted_range <= range_max &&
507  here.ambient_light_at( t ) > here.get_cache_ref( t.z ).natural_light_level_cache ) ) {
508  int range = 0;
509  if( here.ambient_light_at( t ) > here.get_cache_ref( t.z ).natural_light_level_cache ) {
510  range = MAX_VIEW_DISTANCE;
511  } else {
512  range = range_min;
513  }
514  if( has_effect( effect_no_sight ) ) {
515  range = 1;
516  }
517  if( range_mod > 0 ) {
518  range = std::min( range, range_mod );
519  }
520  if( is_avatar ) {
521  // Special case monster -> player visibility, forcing it to be symmetric with player vision.
522  const float player_visibility_factor = get_player_character().visibility() / 100.0f;
523  int adj_range = std::floor( range * player_visibility_factor );
524  return adj_range >= wanted_range &&
525  here.get_cache_ref( pos().z ).seen_cache[pos().x][pos().y] > LIGHT_TRANSPARENCY_SOLID;
526  } else {
527  return here.sees( pos(), t, range );
528  }
529  } else {
530  return false;
531  }
532 }

◆ select_body_part_projectile_attack()

projectile_attack_results Creature::select_body_part_projectile_attack ( const projectile &  proj,
double  goodhit,
double  missed_by 
) const
private

Definition at line 994 of file creature.cpp.

996 {
997  projectile_attack_results ret( proj );
998  const bool magic = proj.proj_effects.count( "MAGIC" ) > 0;
999  double hit_value = missed_by + rng_float( -0.5, 0.5 );
1000  if( magic ) {
1001  // Best possible hit
1002  hit_value = -0.5;
1003  }
1004  // Range is -0.5 to 1.5 -> missed_by will be [1, 0], so the rng addition to it
1005  // will push it to at most 1.5 and at least -0.5
1006  ret.bp_hit = get_anatomy()->select_body_part_projectile_attack( -0.5, 1.5, hit_value );
1007  float crit_mod = get_crit_factor( ret.bp_hit );
1008 
1009  const float crit_multiplier = proj.critical_multiplier;
1010  const float std_hit_mult = std::sqrt( 2.0 * crit_multiplier );
1011  if( magic ) {
1012  // do nothing special, no damage mults, nothing
1013  } else if( goodhit < accuracy_headshot &&
1014  ret.max_damage * crit_multiplier > get_hp_max( ret.bp_hit ) ) {
1015  ret.message = _( "Critical!!" );
1016  ret.gmtSCTcolor = m_headshot;
1017  ret.damage_mult *= rng_float( 0.5 + 0.45 * crit_mod, 0.75 + 0.3 * crit_mod ); // ( 0.95, 1.05 )
1018  ret.damage_mult *= std_hit_mult + ( crit_multiplier - std_hit_mult ) * crit_mod;
1019  ret.is_crit = true;
1020  } else if( goodhit < accuracy_critical &&
1021  ret.max_damage * crit_multiplier > get_hp_max( ret.bp_hit ) ) {
1022  ret.message = _( "Critical!" );
1023  ret.gmtSCTcolor = m_critical;
1024  ret.damage_mult *= rng_float( 0.5 + 0.25 * crit_mod, 0.75 + 0.25 * crit_mod ); // ( 0.75, 1.0 )
1025  ret.damage_mult *= std_hit_mult + ( crit_multiplier - std_hit_mult ) * crit_mod;
1026  ret.is_crit = true;
1027  } else if( goodhit < accuracy_goodhit ) {
1028  ret.message = _( "Good hit!" );
1029  ret.gmtSCTcolor = m_good;
1030  ret.damage_mult *= rng_float( 0.5, 0.75 );
1031  ret.damage_mult *= std_hit_mult;
1032  } else if( goodhit < accuracy_standard ) {
1033  ret.damage_mult *= rng_float( 0.5, 1 );
1034 
1035  } else if( goodhit < accuracy_grazing ) {
1036  ret.message = _( "Grazing hit." );
1037  ret.gmtSCTcolor = m_grazing;
1038  ret.damage_mult *= rng_float( 0, .25 );
1039  }
1040 
1041  return ret;
1042 }

◆ store()

void Creature::store ( JsonOut &  jsout) const
protected

These two functions are responsible for storing and loading the members of this class to/from json data.

All classes that inherit from this class should implement their own version of these functions. They are not virtual on purpose, as it's not needed. Every implementation of those functions should a) call the same function with the same parameters of the super class and b) store/load their own members, but not members of any sub or super class.

The functions are (on purpose) not part of the json serialize/deserialize system (defined in json.h). The Creature class is incomplete, there won't be any instance of that class alone, but there will be instances of sub classes (e.g. player, monster). Those (complete) classes implement the deserialize/serialize interface of json. That way only one json object per npc/player/monster instance is created (inside of the serialize function). E.g. player::serialize() looks like this: json.start_object();store(json);json.end_object() player::store than stores the members of the player class, and it calls Character::store, which stores the members of the Character class and calls Creature::store, which stores the members of the Creature class. All data goes into the single json object created in player::serialize.

Definition at line 3726 of file savegame_json.cpp.

3727 {
3728  jsout.member( "location", location );
3729 
3730  jsout.member( "moves", moves );
3731  jsout.member( "pain", pain );
3732 
3733  // killer is not stored, it's temporary anyway, any creature that has a non-null
3734  // killer is dead (as per definition) and should not be stored.
3735 
3736  jsout.member( "effects", *effects );
3737 
3738  jsout.member( "damage_over_time_map", damage_over_time_map );
3739  jsout.member( "values", values );
3740

◆ reachable_zone

int Creature::reachable_zone = 0
private

This number establishes a partition of zones on the map that have shared reachability/visibility.

In short, if you aren't in the same zone as some other monster, you can ignore them since you won't be able to reach them by any combination of regular movement and vision.

Definition at line 773 of file creature.h.

Referenced by npc::add_msg_player_or_say(), and get_reachable_zone().
